item.title: Below-chance accuracy in MVPA
item.description: Sometimes, the decoding accuracy of MVPA may lower than chance level, which is confusing. I have found several reasons that may lead to below-chance accuracy in decoding analysis. special data structure (bias) model parameters (linear vs. non linear) cross validation methods (leave-one-out vs. k-fold) sample size (small vs. large) In short, below-chance accuracy is likely caused by data structure and decoding methods, which can not be simply interpreted as anti-learning.
